definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: My therapist believes I am certifiably nuts.
sentences.chinese: 我的医生认为，我是个不折不扣的笨蛋。
他是个不折不扣的守财奴。

sentences.english: Hong Kong had been carrying out this policy for nearly 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 港英政府不折不扣地将这一政策执行了近20年。

sentences.english: Of course he was a plain pro-Nazi.
sentences.chinese: 当然，他是个不折不扣的亲纳粹派。

sentences.english: Joy is a real birdbrain in some ways.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊在某些方面是不折不扣的白痴。

sentences.english: We have followed your instructions through to the last detail.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经不折不扣地执行了你的指示。

sentences.english: In my own view, Justgiving is very much a social enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 我个人认为，仅仅给予是一家不折不扣的社会企业。

sentences.english: But in overall, Ayanami was a total mystery.
sentences.chinese: 然而总而言之，绫波是一个不折不扣的迷团。

sentences.english: It transformed nothing less than the literary soul of America.
sentences.chinese: 不折不扣地改造了美国文学的灵魂。

sentences.english: She let themselves become a complete fool.
sentences.chinese: 她使自己变成一个不折不扣地笨疍。

sentences.english: This order is to be obeyed to the letter.
sentences.chinese: 一定要不折不扣地服从这项命令。
他是个不折不扣的傻子。

sentences.english: Jim has become a real desk potato.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆已经成了不折不扣的“桌边神游族”。

sentences.english: Shirly is a professional in every sense of the word.
sentences.chinese: 雪莉是个不折不扣的自由职业者。

sentences.english: Wang is a devotee of snow sculptures.
sentences.chinese: 王海强是位不折不扣的“雪雕迷”。

sentences.english: The instruction should be carried out without any reservation.
sentences.chinese: 应当不折不扣地执行这个指示。

definition: lit. from head to tail (idiom); thoroughgoing/through and through/out and out/from top to bottom
not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
genuine goods at fair prices/(fig.) genuine/real/true
replacement guaranteed if not genuine/fig. authentic
to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag
can be rated as/can be said to be
